channel.title: Scanning for IP addresses of targets
channel.description: I'm new to hacking and I keep hearing about how white hat hackers and black hat hackers are able to penetrate company and government networks. The part of this process I don't really know is how black hat hackers and white hat hackers are able to find the IP addresses of the machines in these networks on the internet when they are first attempting to penetrate these networks without the use of social engineering. It would be really helpful if I could have any information on the techniques used to identify the IP addresses hackers want to target on the internet.

item.title: Scanning for IP addresses of targets
item.dc:creator: bedlam
item.description:
I use nirsoft net, you can get what ip blocks are assigned to what in a given country.
Sometimes there will be blocks listed with no info on what its for & Ill scan them with nmap, -A -p- .
Earlier today I did; nmap -A -p- 62.60.128-254.1-254

nirsoft said 62.60.128.0 to 62.60.255.255 was assigned to, “Iranian Research Organization for Science & Technology”. Made me curious.

Read full topic

Introducing Axiom - The Dynamic Pwnstation Orchestrator for Red Team & Bug Bounty Bug Bounty
Introducing Axiom - The Dynamic Pwnstation Orchestrator [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pry0cc/axiom/master/screenshots/axiom-logo-new.png] Hello, 0x00ers! In this article, I’m going to discuss my new tool Axiom, a few of the concepts around the project, and some potential use cases. I’ve tried to build Axiom to be as extendable as possible so that power users can really use this new tool as an abstraction to use cloud computing systems into their workflows. The repository can be found bel…
Advanced Axiom Usage - axiom-scan Reconnaissance
Hey 0x00ers! You may have heard of the tool I’ve been working on for the past 6 months called axiom, incase you haven’t, I’ll provide you with a quick overview. https://github.com/pry0cc/axiom The dynamic infrastructure framework for anybody! Distribute the workload of many different tools with ease, including nmap, ffuf, masscan, nuclei and many more! Axiom is a larger infrastructure framework that allows you to quickly spin up and down different hackbox hosts packed with tools for you to…

item.title: Scanning for IP addresses of targets
item.dc:creator: EskimoJones
item.description:
I’m new to hacking and I keep hearing about how white hat hackers and black hat hackers are able to penetrate company and government networks. The part of this process I don’t really know is how black hat hackers and white hat hackers are able to find the IP addresses of the machines in these networks on the internet when they are first attempting to penetrate these networks without the use of social engineering. It would be really helpful if I could have any information on the techniques used to identify the IP addresses hackers want to target on the internet.

Read full topic
